alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Calvert; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 12:48PM EDT until May 27 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ANNE ARUNDEL...NORTHWESTERN CALVERT AND SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES... At 1248 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Upper Marlboro to Dunkirk to near Prince Frederick, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Mayo, Shady Side, Chesapeake Beach, Deale, Upper Marlboro, South River, Breezy Point, Rhode River, Rosaryville, Marlton, Dunkirk, Huntingtown, Owings, Baden, Aquasco, Galesville, Friendship, Eagle Harbor, Lower Marlboro and Lothian. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central and southern Maryland. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
